person.persName: Ebenezer Dumont (Indiana, Bank President, Union Army general, US Representative)

body.p: Marion County, Indiana, bank president and soldier. Vevay, Switzerland County, Indiana native. Son of John and Julia Dumont. Married to Mary A. Cheek Dumont on April 18, 1839. Father of Mary Fannie Dumont, Julia L. Dumont, Cornelia Cory Dumont, John F. Dumont, Martha E. Dumont, Emma Dumont, Clinton Charles Dumont, Isabella Dumont, Anna Dumont, Jessie Dumont. Graduate of the University of Indiana. Served in the Indiana State House of Representatives in 1838 and from 1850 to 1853. Served as a Lieutenant Colonel in the Mexican War. Bank President in Marion County, Indiana in 1860. Appointed Colonel in the 7th Regiment Indiana Volunteer Infantry on April 27, 1861; promoted to brigadier general in September 1861. Commander of the 17th Brigade in 1862; Commander of the 12th Division of the Army of the Ohio in 1862. Resigned from the army in 1863. Served in the United States House of Representatives from 1863 until 1867.
